intro: Endiandra lanyuensis, commonly known as the Lanyu endiandra, is a rare evergreen tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
